name: places/ChIJZTOrEKJZwokRcAmNjPbbqQA
formattedAddress: 31 E 17th St, New York, NY 10003, USA
adrFormatAddress: 31 E 17th St, New York, NY 10003, USA

editorialSummary.text: Retailer providing wireless plans & a range of phones, devices & accessories.

originalText.text: I had a great experience at this AT&T store with Les and Dani. They were attentive and helped solve a very complicated phone issue. I had transferred my phone from Tmobile to Mint, which was terrible! Then I had to get my phone number from Mint to AT&T. I had tried to do this switch on the phone with AT&T but the customer service person was terrible and yelled at me. I got to the store with a very complicated case of trying to keep my old phone number to use it for my lab. This was very important to keep my lab phone number. Dani helped me pick a phone and a great plan. My situation was very complicated. Then Les came and solved the earlier layers of problems with Mint and the earlier AT&T customer service issue I had over the phone. He cleared it all up. I spent maybe half an hour at the store and everything was solved. They were so friendly and kind! Les treated me like family and Dani was so kind the entire time. Les was able to carry my phone number to AT&T after I was very close to losing the number. Thank you for truly making this a great New Year! Thank you Les! Thank you Dani!

originalText.text:
A few months ago I needed some help with a new phone and went to a few different AT&T locations. They all turned me down - told me to call customer service (which told me to go to a store), told me to go to another store or to come some other time when the manager is in as they can't do what I needed.
Finally I got to this location and was immediately helped very efficiently and with great service.
This time when I needed a sim swap I came straight here and got what I needed.
Unfortunately I don't remember the employees' names but they were both very nice.
Thank you!

originalText.text:
Lesly or whomever is the guy that is sitting in the table as soon as you walk in, is not it. First I haven’t been able to access my account for a while, I had to get on the phone with At&T for 1 hour 45 min to fix all of his mistakes. He couldn’t even put my zip code correctly so I was locked out of my account.

It’s interesting because I went to another location and they asked me “why does your plan look like this, where did you go?” I told them Union Square and the representatives said “they don’t know what they are doing there.” And it’s CLEAR! Please just walk a few blocks and go somewhere else.

originalText.text: This store on 17th st took over a nightmare experience that I had buying a phone online and turned it into a positive experience. They helped me navigate corporate and helped smooth over the rocky trade in experience. Excellent customer service. I’m sure they could tell I was fuming when I walked in during some visits and and I always walked out of this store satisfied with direction on how to proceed. Thank you so much for your help. I will only go in store to this location moving forward because of their help.

originalText.text: I had upgraded to IPhone 15 and phone arrived in mail on Friday.  I went to local AT&T store to transfer the new phone however the system was down.  I went to another location to transfer the phone and was told that they were unable to assist.  I am a first responder and today during my break went to this union square location to transfer the phone.  I walked 20 min in a heavy rain to this location.  I was assisted by a female sales personnel who got me interested in a “ pink color “ as opposed to the black i phone 15 which I had ordered.  All I wanted was to exchange the phone color which I was told needed the manager’ s approval. I was told one manager was on leave and the other one was in a wedding.  I even offer to pay the restock fee and was told I couldn’t be helped and should go to another location.  I voiced my frustration that I have been to 3 stores already and has waisted my valuable time. The female salesperson along with her coworker became belligerent, argumentative and acted very unprofessional.  At many times I pointed out their inappropriate behaviors and comments. They refused to help me and called the security to escort me out the store. With this type of service, I no longer want to deal with AT&T.
